Linux UPnP Gateway
/post/2010-01-29-linux-upnp-gateway/ 2010-01-29T00:00:00+0000 2010-01-29T00:00:00+0000 Like many other folks out there, I have several computers in my house connected to the outside world via a Linux box acting as a NAT gateway. I often want to use application such as BitTorrent and Freenet, which require that a number of ports be forwarded from my external connection to the particular computer on which I happen to be working. It turns out there’s a protocol for this, called UPnP.
